ownPages.title: strikt.gradle.testkit
ownPages.content:
tasks

Maps this assertion to an assertion on all tasks that were part of the build.

output

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the output.

outcome

Maps this assertion to the task outcome.

path

Maps this assertion to the task path.

task

Maps this assertion to the task at the provided taskPath .

taskPaths

Maps this assertion to the task paths of the build with the provided outcome .

tasks

Maps this assertion to the tasks of the build with the provided outcome .

hasOutcome

Asserts that the outcome is equal to outcome .

isSuccess

Asserts that the outcome is TaskOutcome.SUCCESS.

isFailed

Asserts that the outcome is TaskOutcome.FAILED.

isUpToDate

Asserts that the outcome is TaskOutcome.UP_TO_DATE.

isSkipped

Asserts that the outcome is TaskOutcome.SKIPPED.

isFromCache

Asserts that the outcome is TaskOutcome.FROM_CACHE.

isNoSource

Asserts that the outcome is TaskOutcome.NO_SOURCE.

ownPages.title: strikt.java.time
ownPages.content:
isBefore

Asserts that the subject is before expected .

isAfter

Asserts that the subject is after expected .

get

Maps an assertion on the subject to an assertion on the value of the specified temporal field.

getLong

Maps an assertion on the subject to an assertion on the value of the specified temporal field.

ownPages.title: strikt.java
ownPages.content:
strikt.java.time

name

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the name of the file of the subject.

parent

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the parent file or null if the subject does not have a parent.

parentFile

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the parent file or null if the subject does not have a parent.

extension

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the file extension (not including the dot) or empty string if it not have one.

nameWithoutExtension

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the file name without the extension.

lastModified

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the last modified of the subject.

length

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the file size of the subject.

childFiles

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the child files of the subject.

Note: In contrast to File.listFiles, an empty list is returned for non-directory files.

fileName

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the path representing the name of the subject.

size

Maps this assertion to an assertion over the byte size of the subject path.

propertiesAreEqualTo

Asserts that all properties of the subject match those of other according to either contentEquals in the case of array properties or isEqualTo in other cases.

Properties are identified using Java beans conventions.

toPath

Maps this assertion to an assertion on a path object representing this subject.

lines

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the lines of the subject decoded using the provided charset .

text

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the complete text of the subject decoded using the provided charset .

childFile

Maps this assertion to an assertion on a specific child name of the subject.

exists

Asserts that the file exists.

exists

Asserts that the subject exists, handling symbolic links according to the provided options

notExists

Asserts that the file not exists.

isRegularFile

Asserts that the file is a regular file.

isRegularFile

Asserts that the subject is a regular file, handling symbolic links according to the provided options .

isNotRegularFile

Asserts that the file is not a regular file.

isDirectory

Asserts that the file is a directory.

isDirectory

Asserts that the subject is a directory, handling symbolic links according to the provided options .

isNotDirectory

Asserts that the file is not a directory.

isReadable

Asserts that the file is readable.

isNotReadable

Asserts that the file is not readable.

isWritable

Asserts that the file is writable.

isNotWritable

Asserts that the file is not writable.

isExecutable

Asserts that the file is executable.

isNotExecutable

Asserts that the file is not executable.

isPresent

Asserts that an Optional contains a value (is not empty) and returns an assertion builder whose subject is the value.

isAbsent

Asserts that an Optional does not contain a value.

toNullable

Maps an assertion on a Java Optional to a Kotlin nullable type.

endsWith

Asserts that the subject end with the provided path.

endsWith

Asserts that the subject end with the provided path string.

isAbsolute

Asserts that the subject is an absolute path.

resolve

Maps this assertion to an assertion of this subject resolved with the provided path.

resolve

Maps this assertion to an assertion of this subject resolved with the provided path.

startsWith

Asserts that the subject starts with the provided path.

startsWith

Asserts that the subject starts with the provided path.

toFile

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the file object representing this subject.

isSymbolicLink

Asserts that the subject is a symbolic link.

allBytes

Maps this assertion to an assertion over all bytes of this subject path .

allLines

Maps this assertion to an assertion over all lines of this subject path decoded using the provided charset .

ownPages.title: strikt.spring
ownPages.content:
contentType

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the content type of the servlet response. If the subject has no Content-Type header the subject of the mapped assertion is null.

isCompatibleWith

Asserts that the subject is compatible with expected .

For example, a subject of application/json;charset=UTF-8 is compatiblewith the media type application/json, but not with the media type application/x-yaml.

statusCodeIs1xxInformational

Asserts that the status code is a 1xx Information response.

statusCodeIs2xxSuccess

Asserts that the status code is a 2xx Success response.

statusCodeIs3xxRedirection

Asserts that the status code is a 3xx Redirect response.

statusCodeIs4xxClientError

Asserts that the status code is a 4xx Client Error response.

statusCodeIs5xxServerError

Asserts that the status code is a 5xx Server Error response.

statusCodeIs

Asserts that the status code is equal to expected .

statusCodeIs

Asserts that the status code is equal to expected .

contentTypeIsCompatibleWith

Asserts that the content type of the subject is compatible with expected .

ownPages.title: IncompleteAssertion
ownPages.content:
Thrown to indicate that an assertion chain does not end with an assertion (in other words the state of the assertion group is strikt.api.Status.Pending). This usually means that either:

  1. a mapping function was called but not ultimate followed by an assertion, or
  2. a block is empty.

Thrown to indicate that an assertion chain does not end with an assertion (in other words the state of the assertion group is strikt.api.Status.Pending). This usually means that either:

  1. a mapping function was called but not ultimate followed by an assertion, or
  2. a block is empty.
toString

ownPages.title: AssertionFailed
ownPages.content: toString

ownPages.title: MappingFailed
ownPages.content:
Thrown to indicate that a mapping function such as strikt.api.Assertion.Builder.get or strikt.api.Assertion.Builder.with failed due to an exception thrown by the mapping function.

Thrown to indicate that a mapping function such as strikt.api.Assertion.Builder.get or strikt.api.Assertion.Builder.with failed due to an exception thrown by the mapping function.

toString

ownPages.title: strikt.internal.opentest4j
ownPages.content:
AssertionFailed

IncompleteAssertion

Thrown to indicate that an assertion chain does not end with an assertion (in other words the state of the assertion group is strikt.api.Status.Pending). This usually means that either:

  1. a mapping function was called but not ultimate followed by an assertion, or
  2. a block is empty.
MappingFailed

Thrown to indicate that a mapping function such as strikt.api.Assertion.Builder.get or strikt.api.Assertion.Builder.with failed due to an exception thrown by the mapping function.

ownPages.title: strikt.internal
ownPages.content:
strikt.internal.opentest4j

strikt.internal.reporting

ownPages.title: strikt.assertions
ownPages.content:
length

Maps an assertion on a CharSequence to an assertion on its length.

start

Maps an assertion on the ClosedRange to an assertion on its ClosedRange.start.

endInclusive

Maps an assertion on the ClosedRange to an assertion on its ClosedRange.endInclusive.

size

Maps an assertion on a collection to an assertion on its size.

name

Maps an assertion on an enum to an assertion on its name.

ordinal

Maps an assertion on an enum to an assertion on its ordinal.

message

Maps an assertion on a Throwable to an assertion on its Throwable.message. This mapping also asserts that the message is not null.

cause

Maps an assertion on a Throwable to an assertion on its Throwable.cause.

first

Maps an assertion on a Pair to an assertion on its Pair.first property.

first

Maps an assertion on a Triple to an assertion on its Triple.first property.

second

Maps an assertion on a Pair to an assertion on its Pair.second property.

second

Maps an assertion on a Triple to an assertion on its Triple.second property.

third

Maps an assertion on a Triple to an assertion on its Triple.third property.

isNull

Asserts that the subject is null.

isNotNull

Asserts that the subject is not null.

isA

Asserts that the subject is an instance of T .

isEqualTo

Asserts that the subject is equal to expected according to the standard Kotlin == operator.

isEqualTo

Asserts that the subject is within tolerance of expected .

isEqualTo

Asserts that the subject is within tolerance of expected .

isNotEqualTo

Asserts that the subject is not equal to expected according to the standard Kotlin == operator.

isSameInstanceAs

Asserts that the subject is the same instance as expected according to the standard Kotlin === operator.

isNotSameInstanceAs

Asserts that the subject is not the same instance as expected according to the standard Kotlin === operator.

isContainedIn

Asserts that the subject is contained in expected according to the standard Kotlin in operator.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to Array.contentEquals.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to BooleanArray.contentEquals.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to ByteArray.contentEquals.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to ShortArray.contentEquals.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to IntArray.contentEquals.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to LongArray.contentEquals.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to FloatArray.contentEquals.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to DoubleArray.contentEquals.

contentEquals

Asserts that the subject's content is equal to that of other according to CharArray.contentEquals.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject's content is empty.

isEmpty

Asserts that the subject is the empty string.

toList

Maps an array to a list to make it possible to use the iterable matchers

isTrue

Asserts that the subject is not null and is the boolean value true.

isFalse

Asserts that the subject is not null and is the boolean value false.

hasLength

Asserts that the subject has a CharSequence.length of exactly expected .

isLowerCase

Asserts that the subject is composed of all lower-case characters.

isUpperCase

Asserts that the subject is composed of all upper-case characters.

startsWith

Asserts that the subject starts with the expected character.

startsWith

Asserts that the subject starts with the expected string.

endsWith

Asserts that the subject ends with the expected character.

endsWith

Asserts that the subject ends with the expected string.

matches

Asserts that the subject is a full match for the expected regular expression.

matchesIgnoringCase

Asserts that the subject is a full match for the expected regular expression regardless of case.

contains

Asserts that the subject contains a match for the expected regular expression.

contains

Asserts that the subject contains the expected substring.

contains

Asserts that the subject range contains the provided element .

contains

Asserts that all elements are present in the subject. The elements may exist in any order any number of times and the subject may contain further elements that were not specified. If either the subject or elements are empty the assertion always fails.

contains

Asserts that all elements are present in the subject. The elements may exist in any order any number of times and the subject may contain further elements that were not specified. If either the subject or elements are empty the assertion always fails.

containsIgnoringCase

Asserts that the subject contains a match for the expected regular expression regardless of case.

containsIgnoringCase

Asserts that the subject contains the expected substring regardless of case.

isNullOrEmpty

Asserts that the subject is null or the empty string.

isNullOrBlank

Asserts that the subject is null, empty, or contains only whitespace characters.

isBlank

Asserts that the subject is empty, or contains only whitespace characters.

isNotEmpty

Asserts that the subject is not the empty string (contains at least one character).

isNotBlank

Asserts that the subject is not blank (contains at least one non-whitespace character).

trim

Trims the subject CharSequence.

trim

Trims the subject string.

hasSize

Asserts that the subject has a Collection.size of exactly expected .

isGreaterThan

Asserts that the subject compares greater than expected according to Kotlin's standard > operator.

isLessThan

Asserts that the subject compares less than expected according to Kotlin's standard < operator.

isGreaterThanOrEqualTo

Asserts that the subject compares greater than or equal to expected according to Kotlin's standard >= operator.

isLessThanOrEqualTo

Asserts that the subject compares less than or equal to expected according to Kotlin's standard <= operator.

isIn

Asserts that the subject is in the expected range.

isOneOf

Asserts that the subject is one of values .

count

Maps this assertion to an assertion over the count of elements in the subject.

count

Maps this assertion to an assertion over the count of elements matching predicate .

map

Applies Iterable.map with function to the subject and returns an assertion builder wrapping the result.

first

Maps this assertion to an assertion over the first element in the subject iterable.

first

Maps this assertion to an assertion over the first element in the subject iterable that matches predicate .

withFirst

Runs a group of assertions on the first element in the subject iterable.

withFirst

Runs a group of assertions on the first element in the subject iterable that matches predicate .

elementAt

Maps this assertion to an assertion over the indexed element in the subject iterable.

withElementAt

Runs a group of assertions on the element at index in the subject iterable.

single

Maps this assertion to an assertion over the single element in the subject iterable.

last

Maps this assertion to an assertion over the last element in the subject iterable.

withLast

Runs a group of assertions on the last element in the subject iterable.

flatMap

Maps this assertion to an assertion over a flattened list of the results of transform for each element in the subject iterable.

filter

Maps this assertion to an assertion over a list of all elements of the subject that match predicate.

filterNot

Maps this assertion to an assertion over a list of all elements of the subject that do not match predicate.

filterIsInstance

Maps this assertion to an assertion over a list of all elements of the subject that are instances of R.

all

Asserts that all elements of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

allIndexed

Asserts that all elements of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

any

Asserts that at least one element of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

anyIndexed

Asserts that at least one element of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

none

Asserts that no elements of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

noneIndexed

Asserts that no elements of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

one

Asserts that exactly one element of the subject passes the assertions in predicate .

atLeast

Asserts that at least count elements of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

atMost

Asserts that at most count elements of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

exactly

Asserts that exactly count elements of the subject pass the assertions in predicate .

doesNotContain

Asserts that none of elements are present in the subject.

If elements is empty the assertion always fails. If the subject is empty the assertion always passe.

doesNotContain

Asserts that none of elements are present in the subject.

If elements is empty the assertion always fails. If the subject is empty the assertion always passe.

containsExactly

Asserts that all elements and no others are present in the subject in the specified order.

If the subject has no guaranteed iteration order (for example a Set) this assertion is probably not appropriate and you should use containsExactlyInAnyOrder instead.

containsExactly

Asserts that all elements and no others are present in the subject in the specified order.

If the subject has no guaranteed iteration order (for example a Set) this assertion is probably not appropriate and you should use containsExactlyInAnyOrder instead.

containsExactlyInAnyOrder

Asserts that all elements and no others are present in the subject. Order is not evaluated, so an assertion on a List will pass so long as it contains all the same elements with the same cardinality as elements regardless of what order they appear in.

containsExactlyInAnyOrder

Asserts that all elements and no others are present in the subject. Order is not evaluated, so an assertion on a List will pass so long as it contains all the same elements with the same cardinality as elements regardless of what order they appear in.

isSorted

Asserts that the subject iterable is sorted according to the Comparator. Empty iterables are considered sorted.

isSorted

Asserts that the subject iterable is sorted according to the natural order of its elements. Empty iterables are considered sorted.

get

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the element at index i in the subject list.

get

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the elements at the sub-list represented by range in the subject list.

get

Maps this assertion to an assertion on the value indexed by key in the subject list.

containsSequence

Asserts that all elements are present in the subject in exactly the same order

containsSequence

Asserts that all elements are present in the subject in exactly the same order

getValue

Asserts that key exists in the subject map and then maps this assertion to an assertion on the associated value.

withValue

Runs a group of assertions on the value in the subject map tht corresponds to key .

containsKey

Asserts that the subject map contains an entry indexed by key . Depending on the map implementation the value associated with key may be null. This assertion just tests for the existence of the key.

containsKeys

Asserts that the subject map contains entries for all keys .

hasEntry

Asserts that the subject map contains an entry indexed by key with a value equal to value .

isFailure

Asserts that the result of an action did throw an exception and maps to an assertion on the exception. The assertion fails if the subject's Result.isFailure returns false.

isSuccess

Asserts that the result of an action did not throw any exception and maps to an assertion on the result value. The assertion fails if the subject's Result.isSuccess returns false.

succeeded

Asserts that the subject is a successful result and maps this assertion to an assertion over the result value.

failed

Asserts that the subject is a failed result and maps this assertion to an assertion over the exception that was thrown

failedWith

Asserts that the subject is a isFailure result that threw an exception assignable to E and maps this assertion to an assertion over that exception.

doesNotThrow

Deprecated form of isSuccess ().

isEqualToIgnoringCase

Asserts that the subject is equal to the expected value regardless of case.

ownPages.title: CompoundAssertions
ownPages.content:
Returned by Assertion.Builder.compose allowing a bridge between evaluation of composed assertions and the determination of the overall result in the block parameter passed to then .

then

Determine the overall status of a compound assertion based on the results of its child assertions.

ownPages.title: AtomicAssertion
ownPages.content:
An assertion of a single condition on a subject.

pass

Mark this result as passed due to a comparison between two values.

fail

Mark this result as failed due to a comparison between two values.

ownPages.title: CompoundAssertion
ownPages.content:
An assertion composed of multiple conditions whose overall result is determined by some aggregation of those conditions' results.

anyFailed

true if at least one composed assertion failed, otherwise false.

allFailed

true if all composed assertions failed, otherwise false.

anyPassed

true if at least one composed assertion passed, otherwise false.

allPassed

true if all composed assertions passed, otherwise false.

passedCount

the number of composed assertions that passed.

failedCount

the number of composed assertions that failed.

ownPages.title: DescribeableBuilder
ownPages.content:
Extension of Assertion.Builder that enables the description of the assertion subject.

Since it doesn't make sense to do this anywhere except directly after the initial expectThat or Assertion.Builder.with call those methods return an instance of this interface, while assertions themselves just return Assertion.Builder .

describedAs

Adds a description to the assertion.

describedAs

Adds a description to the assertion.

Asserts that the subject is null.

isNotNull

Asserts that the subject is not null.

isA

Asserts that the subject is an instance of T .

isEqualTo

Asserts that the subject is equal to expected according to the standard Kotlin == operator.

isEqualTo

Asserts that the subject is within tolerance of expected .

Asserts that the subject is within tolerance of expected .

isNotEqualTo

Asserts that the subject is not equal to expected according to the standard Kotlin == operator.

Asserts that the subject is the same instance as expected according to the standard Kotlin === operator.

Asserts that the subject is not the same instance as expected according to the standard Kotlin === operator.

isContainedIn

Asserts that the subject is contained in expected according to the standard Kotlin in operator.

ownPages.title: Builder
ownPages.content:
Used to construct assertions.

assert

Evaluates a condition that may pass or fail.

While this method can be used directly in a test but is typically used inside an extension method on Assertion.Builder such as those provided in the strikt.assertions package.

assert

Evaluates a condition that may pass or fail.

While this method can be used directly in a test but is typically used inside an extension method on Assertion.Builder such as those provided in the strikt.assertions package.

compose

Allows an assertion to be composed of multiple sub-assertions such as on fields of an object or elements of a collection.

The results of assertions made inside the assertions block are included under the overall assertion result.

compose

Allows an assertion to be composed of multiple sub-assertions such as on fields of an object or elements of a collection.

The results of assertions made inside the assertions block are included under the overall assertion result.

passesIf

Evaluates a boolean condition. This is useful for implementing the simplest types of assertion function.

passesIf

Evaluates a boolean condition. This is useful for implementing the simplest types of assertion function.

assertThat

Evaluates a boolean condition. This is useful for implementing the simplest types of assertion function.

assertThat

Evaluates a boolean condition. This is useful for implementing the simplest types of assertion function.

get

Maps the assertion subject to the result of function . This is useful for chaining to property values or method call results on the subject.

If function is a callable reference, (for example a getter or property reference) the subject description will be automatically determined for the returned assertion builder.

If function is a lambda, Strikt will make a best-effort attempt to determine an appropriate function / property name.

get

Maps the assertion subject to the result of function . This is useful for chaining to property values or method call results on the subject.

with

Runs a group of assertions on the subject returned by function .

with

Runs a group of assertions on the subject returned by function .

chain

Deprecated form of with ((T) -> R).

chain

Deprecated form of with (String, (T) -> R).

not

Reverses any assertions chained after this method.

not

Evaluates a block of assertions on the current subject by executing them in reverse.

and

Evaluates a block of assertions on the current subject.

The main use for this method is after strikt.assertions.isNotNull or strikt.assertions.isA in order that a group of assertions can more conveniently be performed on the narrowed subject type.

This method may be used as an infix function which tends to enhance readability when it directly follows a lambda.

ownPages.title: Assertion
ownPages.content:
Allows assertion implementations to determine a result.

pass

Mark this result as passed.

fail

Mark this result as failed.

ownPages.title: ExpectationBuilder
ownPages.content:
Receiver for expect providing functions that define assertion subjects and create assertion chains or blocks.

that

Start a chain of assertions over subject .

that

Evaluate a block of assertions over subject .

catching

Start a chain of assertions over the result of action .

ownPages.title: strikt.api
ownPages.content:
Assertion

Allows assertion implementations to determine a result.

AtomicAssertion

An assertion of a single condition on a subject.

CompoundAssertion

An assertion composed of multiple conditions whose overall result is determined by some aggregation of those conditions' results.

CompoundAssertions

Returned by Assertion.Builder.compose allowing a bridge between evaluation of composed assertions and the determination of the overall result in the block parameter passed to then .

DescribeableBuilder

Extension of Assertion.Builder that enables the description of the assertion subject.

Since it doesn't make sense to do this anywhere except directly after the initial expectThat or Assertion.Builder.with call those methods return an instance of this interface, while assertions themselves just return Assertion.Builder .

ExpectationBuilder

Receiver for expect providing functions that define assertion subjects and create assertion chains or blocks.

expect

Starts a block of assertions that will all be evaluated regardless of whether earlier ones fail. This is the entry-point for the assertion API.

expectThat

Start a chain of assertions over subject . This is the entry-point for the assertion API.

expectThat

Evaluate a block of assertions over subject . This is the entry-point for the assertion API.

expectThrows

Asserts that action throws an exception of type E when executed.

expectCatching

Start a chain of assertions over the result of action which may either be the value action returns or any exception it throws. This is the entry-point for the assertion API.

ownPages.title: strikt.protobuf
ownPages.content:
isEmpty

Asserts that a com.google.protobuf.Any is empty and does not contain an object of any kind.

unpacksTo

Asserts that the subject is a message of type T .

unpack

Maps an assertion on com.google.protobuf.Any to an assertion on an unpacked message of type T .

ownPages.title: strikt.mockk
ownPages.content:
captured

Maps this assertion to an assertion whose subject is the captured value of the CapturingSlot.

isCaptured

Asserts that the subject has captured a value.

withCaptured

Runs a group of assertions on the captured value.

ownPages.title: strikt.jackson
ownPages.content:
has

Asserts that the subject node has a field named fieldName .

path

Maps the subject node of the assertion builder to the node accessed by fieldName .

at

Maps the subject node of the assertion builder to the node accessed by pointer .

at

Maps the subject node of the assertion builder to the node accessed by pointer .

isObject

Asserts that the subject node is a JSON object.

isArray

Asserts that the subject node is a JSON array.

isTextual

Asserts that the subject node is a JSON text node.

isNumber

Asserts that the subject node is a JSON numeric node.

isBoolean

Asserts that the subject node is a JSON boolean node.

isMissing

Asserts that the subject node is a JSON missing node.

textValue

Maps the assertion to an assertion on the subject node's text value.

Be aware that if the node is not a text node this will map to an assertion on null.

numberValue

Maps the assertion to an assertion on the subject node's number value.

Be aware that if the node is not a numeric node this will map to an assertion on null.

booleanValue

Maps the assertion to an assertion on the subject node's boolean value.

Be aware that if the node is not a boolean node this will map to an assertion on false.

findValuesAsText

Maps the assertion to an assertion on the text values of fieldName in each child of the current node.

hasNodeType

Asserts that the subject node's JsonNode.getNodeType method returns nodeType .

Convenient aliases for this assertion exist for common node types that also narrow the subject type of the resulting assertion builder.

hasSize

Asserts that a JSON array's size is equal to expected .

size

Maps an assertion on a JSON array to an assertion on its size.

textValues

Maps an assertion on a JSON array to an assertion on the text values of all nodes in the array.

ownPages.title: strikt.arrow
ownPages.content:
b

Unwraps the containing value of the Either.Right

value

Unwraps the containing value of the Either.Right

value

Unwraps the containing value of the Either.Left

value

Unwraps the containing value of the Some

value

Unwraps the containing value of the Validated.Valid

value

Unwraps the containing value of the Validated.Invalid

a

Unwraps the containing value of the Either.Left

a

Unwraps the containing value of the Validated.Valid

t

Unwraps the containing value of the Some

e

Unwraps the containing value of the Validated.Invalid

isRight

Asserts that the Either is Either.Right

isRight

Asserts that the Either is Either.Right and that it contains the exact value

isLeft

Asserts that the Either is Either.Left

isLeft

Asserts that the Either is Either.Left and that it contains the exact value

isNone

Asserts that the Option is None

isSome

Asserts that the Option is Some

isSome

Asserts that the Option is Some and that it contains the exact value

isValid

Asserts that the Validated is Validated.Valid

isValid

Asserts that the Validated is Validated.Valid and that it contains the exact value

isInvalid

Asserts that the Validated is Validated.Invalid

isInvalid

Asserts that the Validated is Validated.Invalid and that it contains the exact value

ownPages.title: Gradle Module
ownPages.content:
Gradle

Extensions for assertions and traversals on Gradle's test kit.

Add the following to your dependencies:

testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-gradle:0.31.0")

ownPages.title: JVM Module
ownPages.content:
JVM

Extensions for assertions and traversals on types from the Java SDK.

Add the following to your dependencies:

testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-jvm:0.31.0")

ownPages.title: Spring Module
ownPages.content:
Spring

Extensions for testing code that uses the Spring Framework.

Add the following to your dependencies:

testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-spring:0.31.0")

ownPages.title: Core API
ownPages.content:
Core

The core API for Strikt.

Add the following to your dependencies:

testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-core:0.31.0")

ownPages.title: Bill of Materials
ownPages.content:
Using the Bill of Materials (BOM)

If you're using multiple Strikt modules (and Gradle >= 5.0) you can import Strikt's BOM and then omit versions for individual modules. For example:

dependencies {
  testImplementation(platform("io.strikt:strikt-bom:0.31.0"))
  testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-arrow")
  testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-jackson")
  testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-jvm")
}

ownPages.title: Protobuf Module
ownPages.content:
Protobuf

Extensions for testing code that uses Protobuf / gRPC.

Add the following to your dependencies:

testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-protobuf:0.31.0")

ownPages.title: MockK Module
ownPages.content:
Mockk

Extensions for assertions and traversals on types from the Mockk mocking and verification library.

Add the following to your dependencies:

testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-mockk:0.31.0")

ownPages.title: Jackson Module
ownPages.content:
Jackson

Extensions for assertions and traversals on types Jackson's JsonNode and sub-types.

Add the following to your dependencies:

testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-jackson:0.31.0")

ownPages.title: Arrow Module
ownPages.content:
Arrow

Extensions for assertions and traversals on types from the Arrow's functional programming library.

Add the following to your dependencies:

testImplementation("io.strikt:strikt-arrow:0.31.0")
